CatDescriptText: Mr. William E. (Bill) Miller, State Compensation Referee, 1010 Premier St., was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column, published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 12, 1959, pg. A13 with question: "Do you think that the President of the United States should intervene in the steel strike, or should he wait, and then invoke the 80-day 'cooling off' period as prescribed in the Taft-Hartley Act?" answer reads: "I don't think the President should intervene. Let the union and management work it out between them.  The Taft-Hartley Act is anti-labor."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of William E. (Bill) Miller wearing moustache and light colored button down collared shirt with short sleeves and breast pocket, standing on sidewalk next to decorative brick building in front of open door with Lounge inscribed above
